title: Riot: *designs entirely teamplay dependent champion* Players: *30% winrate*

replies.body: Quite frankly, after playing with and against Yuumi for a couple of games, I was thinking "man this kit would be right at home in HotS"... because unfortunately these team-reliant kits don't fit in in the one-shot-or-be-one-shot meta.

> [{quoted}](name=floppy1000,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lqKitoAX,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-05-17T04:43:09.584+0000)
>
> Quite frankly, after playing with and against Yuumi for a couple of games, I was thinking "man this kit would be right at home in HotS"... because unfortunately these team-reliant kits don't fit in in the one-shot-or-be-one-shot meta.

You get to feed twice as fast bot lane when the ADC gets caught out.

Nah, fam, you use it to trick the TF into thinking you're going to help their gank.

Press W when he ults, then detach just before he finishes warping. Like the classic Nunu+Ryze R fail.

> [{quoted}](name=floppy1000,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lqKitoAX,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-05-17T04:43:09.584+0000)
>
> Quite frankly, after playing with and against Yuumi for a couple of games, I was thinking "man this kit would be right at home in HotS"... because unfortunately these team-reliant kits don't fit in in the one-shot-or-be-one-shot meta.

Alongside Abby and Cho'gall?
FOUR HEADED OGRE TECHNIQUE!
Just watch, she'll be too strong in coordinated play and remain a 30-40% WR "champion" until her inevitable rework in eight years.

Yeah, and a new mechanic can reasonably account for maybe a 44% win rate. 40% if you wanna stretch, despite the fact that's never happened either. 

But 30%? That reasonably means one of two things: 

Either: 

* The mechanic is one that does not belong in League of Legends.
or

* The whole kit is non-cohesive. 

And I'd wager in this case it's the former.

Actually, it's also plausible that her numbers were simply too low in addition to players not knowing how to play her.

I faced her once in ARAM and she did really well. I suspect that player already had a game or two on her.

In regards to SR, a new champion being 40-45 isn't unusual. Below 40 suggests that EVERYTHING is too weak.

30% isn't plausible. 

And no, it's not 40-45, it's minimum 44.

That was her win rate in Platinum+ within the past 2 days (38%).

Also, Kai'Sa had a win rate below 45% at first because people didn't know how to play her and was later buffed across the board.
Uhuh. Notice how you said "below 45" because it was my stated 44.

Yes, but that was solely due to a lack of knowledge in how to play her. Not because she was inherently weak. Players soon knew how to play her and her win rate skyrocketed after the buffs were put in.

You can't make that claim with the buffs in place. 

She didn't come with any new mechanics, either.
She's like Wukong, ARAM brings out their strength with having lots of teammates and enemies around but both have pretty crap lane phases.
When you work so hard to destroy strategy and tactics from the game but then throw in a team-player champion, this will happen.
Riot designs weak AF champion, Riot fanboys: "I's all the playerbase's fault!"
Yeah... another enchanter i'm never going to play.
